definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Peering out his door into the night, he recognized the face of a trusted neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 他开门窥望，夜色中认出是一位可靠的邻居。

sentences.english: The trees, like the longings of the earth, stand a tiptoe to peep at the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 群树如表示大地的愿望似的，竖趾立着，向天空窥望。

sentences.english: And as Judas was speaking these words, behold part of them appeared looking forth from the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 犹大还在说话时，发现有一部分敌人从山上窥望。

sentences.english: Pray, do not go for a peep at the curtains yonder there!
sentences.chinese: 人家挂着窗帘呢，别去窥望。

sentences.english: The trees, like the 6)longings of the earth, stand a-tiptoe to peep at the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 群树如表示大地的愿望似的，踮起脚来向天空窥望。

sentences.english: The trees, like the longings of the earth, stand atiptoe to peep at the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 群树如表示大地的愿望似的，踮起脚来向天空窥望。

sentences.english: The trees. like the longings of the eartistic creofionh. stand a tiptoe to peep of.
sentences.chinese: 群树如表示大地的愿望似的，踮起脚来向天外窥望。

sentences.english: She peered at the stranger from behind the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 她躲在窗帘后面窥望陌生人。

definition: to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to visit/to go to see what's going on
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
to survey the scene from an elevated position
to walk on tiptoe/to step on sb's foot/to join (a trade, profession etc)/to associate with (a certain group of people)
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to shade one's eyes with one's hand
